reviewText: What a gorgeous movie! Imelda Staunton (Downton Abbey) was fabulous as usual. A lovely story, well told, leaving you with the 'warm fuzzies'. Ok by me!
Romantic movie that is done well. Has some historical scenes that bring life to the film and the music and dance scenes really make it fun.
Very nice and eccentric musical comedy. Very British sense of humor.
OK at best!  Very make believe!
Wonderful movie! Very well done! Not your typical musical at all! A real pleasure to watch.
Lucky chance I stumbled on this!  What a delight. Absolutely charming.

Just watched this on ACORN streaming. What a wonderful film. Imelda Staunton (Mrs. Carson, i.e., wife of actor Jim Carter) is just lovely as is her co-star Michael Ball. Two people who were in the same children's chorus in Manchester, England in 1929 meet in 1969 -- enough said. Please, please watch this lovely film! Only the Brits do this sort of thing -- and they do it SO WELL!!!
Refreshing, sweet, and utterly original. I am so glad I stumbled upon this.
Victoris Wood is a great comedian and has given us a musical gem that flashes back between 1969 and 1929. Love Imelda Staunton, so this was very good fun.
As I was born in 1948, I was able to relate to so many parts of this movie. I thoroughly enjoyed it, different, quirky and so uplifting.
A genuine treasure!  Don't miss this one--Imelda Staunton is magnificent!!!
One of the Happiest Movies we have seen in decades -- a real Must for Joy lovers !!
liked it a lot. light hearted musical with a touching story
This is a delightful comedy-musical about everyday life in Manchester.  It is extremely different and creative.  I've never encountered anything like it.

Yes, it's a silly affair, but it is also extremely entertaining.  Well worth watching and a welcome break from most of the dark brooding programs we see or humor films and try-too-hard TV series that are often disappointing.

An unusual musical in which two children who sang in the Manchester Childrens' Choir are reunited, in middle age, at a documentary about the choir. Interesting method of showing the paths their lives took and of bringing them together at the end. Nice staging, good voices, warm story. A pleasant way to spend a cool, dreary, rainy afternoon.
